name: Intention
description: a conscious decision to perform a behavior or a resolve to act in a certain way

name: Social Learning/Imitation
description: a process by which thoughts, feelings, and motivational states observed in others are internalized and replicated without the need for conscious awareness

name: Goals
description: mental representations of outcomes or end states that an individual wants to achieve

name: Attitude
description: A positive/negative attitude towards the behavior.

name: Environmental Context and Resources
description: aspects of a person’s situation or environment that discourage or encourage the behavior

name: Emotion
description: a complex reaction pattern involving experiential, behavioral, and physiological elements

name: Beliefs about Consequences
description: beliefs about the consequences of a behavior (i.e., perceptions about what will be achieved and/or lost by undertaking a behavior, as well as the probability that a behavior will lead to a specific outcome)

name: Knowledge
description: an awareness of the existence of something

name: Reinforcement
description: processes by which the frequency or probability of a response is increased through a dependent relationship or contingency with a stimulus or circumstance

name: Optimism
description: confidence that things will happen for the best or that desired goals will be attained

name: Needs
description: deficit of something required for survival, well-being, or personal fulfillment

name: Values
description: moral, social, or aesthetic principles accepted by an individual or society as a guide to what is good, desirable, or important

name: Beliefs about Capabilities
description: beliefs about one’s ability to successfully carry out a behavior

name: Skills
description: an ability or proficiency acquired through practice

name: General Attitudes/Beliefs
description: evaluations of an object, person, group, issue, or concept on a scale ranging from negative to positive

name: Subjective Norms
description: one’s perceptions of what most other people within a social group believe and do

name: Norms
description: the attitudes held and behaviors exhibited by other people within a social group

name: Feedback Processes
description: processes through which current behavior is compared against a particular standard

name: Social/Professional Role and Identity
description: a coherent set of behaviors and displayed personal qualities of an individual in a social or work setting

name: Perceived Susceptibility/Vulnerability
description: perceptions of the likelihood that one is vulnerable to a threat.

name: Motivation
description: processes relating to the impetus that gives purpose or direction to behavior and operates at a conscious or unconscious level

name: Behavioral Regulation
description: behavioral, cognitive, and/or emotional skills for managing or changing behavior

name: Memory, Attention, and Decision Processes
description: ability to retain information, focus on aspects of the environment, and choose between two or more alternatives

name: Behavioral Cueing
description: processes by which behavior is triggered from either the external environment, the performance of another behavior, or from ideas appearing in consciousness

name: Social Influences
description: those interpersonal processes that can cause oneself to change one’s thoughts, feelings or behaviors

name: Self-Image
description: one’s conception and evaluation of oneself, including psychological and physical characteristics, qualities, and skills
